travels.title: Panama '06
travels.headertext: We visited Panama in 2006. We started in Panama City where we saw the city and did a Panama Canal day cruise. Then we flew to David, in western Panama, and drove to Boquete and the south side of Volcan Baru. After several days there, we drove around to the north side of the volcano and stayed at Cerro Punta.

entry.text: We took a day trip of the Panama Canal. This was a great way to see it. You take a small (about 150 person) boat from Panama City and spend the day transiting the entire canal over to the Caribbean at Colon. Then you take a bus back to Panama City.
The climate on the slopes of Vulcan Baru is near perfect. They call it perpetual spring. The forest is verdant and everything seems very lush and green.
The slopes of the volcano are also a coffee growing region. We took a tour of one of the coffee plantations.
We did some nice hiking in the national parks around the volcano.
